TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DownloadManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The download manager is a system service that handles long-running HTTP downloads.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int javaReference, valuetype Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) cil managed

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.
Broadcast intent action sent by the download manager when a download completes.
Broadcast intent action sent by the download manager when the user clicks on a running download, either from a system notification or from the downloads UI.
Intent action to launch an activity to display all downloads.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual long AddCompletedDownload (string title, string description, bool isMediaScannerScannable, string mimeType, string path, long length, bool showNotification);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 AddCompletedDownload(string title, string description, bool isMediaScannerScannable, string mimeType, string path, int64 length, bool showNotification) cil managed

abstract member AddCompletedDownload : string * string * bool * string * string * int64 * bool -> int64 override this.AddCompletedDownload : string * string * bool * string * string * int64 * bool -> int64
MemberSignature.Usage: downloadManager.AddCompletedDownload (title, description, isMediaScannerScannable, mimeType, path, length, showNotification)

Docs.param: the title that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
the description that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
true if the file is to be scanned by MediaScanner. Files scanned by MediaScanner appear in the applications used to view media (for example, Gallery app).

absolute pathname to the file. The file should be world-readable, so that it can be managed by the Downloads App and any other app that is used to read it (for example, Gallery app to display the file, if the file contents represent a video/image).
true if a notification is to be sent, false otherwise
Docs.summary: Adds a file to the downloads database system, so it could appear in Downloads App (and thus become eligible for management by the Downloads App).

Docs.summary: To be added.
Number of bytes download so far.
The client-supplied description of this download.
An identifier for a particular download, unique across the system.
Timestamp when the download was last modified, in (wall clock time in UTC).
The pathname of the file where the download is stored.
Uri where downloaded file will be stored.
The URI to the corresponding entry in MediaProvider for this downloaded entry.
Internet Media Type of the downloaded file.
Provides more detail on the status of the download.
Current status of the download, as one of the STATUS_* constants.
The client-supplied title for this download.
Total size of the download in bytes.
URI to be downloaded.

Docs.summary: Value of when some possibly transient error occurred but we can't resume the download.

Docs.summary: Value of when no external storage device was found.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.DownloadError enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Value of when the requested destination file already exists (the download manager will not overwrite an existing file).

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.DownloadError enum directly instead of this field.")

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.DownloadError enum directly instead of this field.")

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.DownloadError enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Value of COLUMN_ERROR_CODE when the download has completed with an error that doesn't fit under any other error code.
Intent extra included with intents, indicating the ID (as a long) of the download that just completed.
When clicks on multiple notifications are received, the following provides an array of download ids corresponding to the download notification that was clicked.
